newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland may sell two soda firms next week - paper.
newsitem.headline: Poland may sell two soda firms next week - paper.

text.p: Poland's privatisation ministry will probably sell off the country's main soda producers next week and the likely buyer is large state-controlled chemical trader Ciech SA, the Rzeczpospolita daily said on Thursday.
The companies, in which the ministry offers 75 percent stakes, are Janikowskie Zaklady Sodowe Janikosoda SA and Inowroclawskie Zaklady Chemiczne Soda Matwy SA, both in central Poland.

Rzeczpospolita quoted deputy Privatisation Minister Leszek Juchniewicz that out of the two bidders for the plants -- France's Rhone-Poulenc SA and Poland's state-controlled Ciech SA -- the latter stood a stronger chance of winning the tender.
"We were in favour of the French, but Ciech made a better offer," Juchniewicz told the Reczpospolita.
Ciech, now 53 percent-owned by the state treasury, is slated for flotation in the first quarter of 1997.
Janikosoda SA employs 1,600 workers and had a 4.1 million zloty net profit on 155.5 million zloty sales in 1994.
Matwy SA, employing 1,900 workers, had 5.9 million zlotys of net profit and 155.6 million zlotys of sales in 1994.
